p: Two reactions with inorganic compounds have been invoked for the genesis of native sulfur in epigenetic deposits. The first concept proposes a redox reaction that essentially does the opposite of a sulfur disproportionation reaction ( Feely and Kulp, 1957) by combining a sulfur compound with a positive and a sulfur compound with a negative oxidation state to form zero-valent sulfur.
